intro: Catanthera multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered catanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky substance. Catanthera multiflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats.
